feed.title: IOWarp - News & Updates
feed.subtitle: Latest releases, announcements, partnerships, and research updates from the IOWarp project
feed.rights: Copyright Â© 2025 IOWarp Project - Gnosis Research Center

entry.title: National Science Foundation Awards $5M Grant for Context Engineering Research
entry.summary: IOWarp receives $5M NSF grant (Award #2411318) to advance context engineering for autonomous scientific workflows through 2029. PIs offer insights into the IOWarp vision and team objectives.

entry.title: Dr. Luke Logan Appointed as IOWarp Head Engineer
entry.summary: PhD graduate from Illinois Institute of Technology specializing in high-performance storage and memory systems. Luke leads IOWarp platform architecture and technical development.

entry.title: Illinois Institute of Technology Features IOWarp Project
entry.summary: IIT highlights how IOWarp is transforming scientific data management through context engineering. Third consecutive multi-million-dollar NSF grant for the Gnosis Research Center.

entry.title: IOWarp Platform Beta Release
entry.summary: Official release of IOWarp runtime with Content Assimilation Engine, Content Transfer Engine, 15+ MCP servers. Zero-config Docker deployment demonstrates 7.5x speedup in scientific workflows.

entry.title: IOWarp Agent-Toolkit Release
entry.summary: 15+ MCP servers with 150+ specialized tools for scientific computing. Enables AI agents to interact with HPC resources, research datasets, and scientific workflows. MIT licensed.
